page.title: 17Education of the deaf
page.content: Attached to the William Sharp School is a Hearing Impaired Unit.This unique educational establishment was set up in 1972 when it was realised that the Ewing School for the Deaf in Nottingham could no longer provide for the educational and social needs of its secondary aged pupils.It was thought that a unit attached to a normal comprehensive school could.At the school all pupils both hearing impaired and normal share break and lunch time facilities,register together and participate in craft and P.E lessons.How many other lessons a hearing impaired pupil will receive with the hearing children depends on that child's hearing loss and ability. Partially hearing children spend most of their time in the main school with back-up from teachers of the deaf.
